page.title: 18BINTON HILL FORGE
page.content: The Blacksmith at Binton Hill Forge works mainly for the Royal Shakespeare Company in Stratford and is responsible for all their metal properties.He has been a Blacksmith all his life but he has never shod any horses.He works in steel, aluminium and iron.The swords he makes for RSC plays are individually made to fit the actor for weight etc. and cost about Â£l00.It is not sharp but looks to have a fine edge.He attends the rehearsals to ensure that all his objects are satisfactory as sometimes they need alteration.Besides making armour and weapons he also makes scenery, moving equipment e.g. bicycles and furniture. In the forge he uses hammer anvil and pliers.The fuel used is fine coke and there is a fan which blows the fire. While working he often gets burned.
